data.title: Good, almost great...
data.text: Lovely cocktails (could do with a list though). Solid 8/10 for lomo saltado and great ceviche. Needs to up the game (but not by all that much) to compete and draw crowds from la limena...

data.title: Tasty and filling
data.text:
I just got back from Sazon Inka and I am truly full and I only ate half of my food. Let me begin with the positives.

The portion sizes are truly pretty big. I ordered a Lomo Saltado and it was a legit two meals in size. Yay for doggy bags. My family which I went with ordered a whole chicken with 4 sides for 20 dollars, which considering the size of the sides is fair. My Lomo Saltado consisted of deliciously marinated steak strips with onion and tomatoes on yuca fries. The yuca fries were not the best I had, but the steak was da bomb diggity aka tasty. My server, Jessenia, was very positive and kept checking in on us. They had 3 different sauces to try with our fries and yuca that tasted like magic and luck had a baby in sauce form. My taste buds couldn't get enough of those sauces.

Some of the negatives were they seemed to be out of stock of a few items. They were out of Horchata and some hot sauce for our whole Peruvian chicken. In addition they were having issues with the AC system not working. I felt fine, but my family was sweating bullets.

If you eat at the restaurant you can get 2 free hours of parking which is great since the area is full of paid parking, but no free spots. All in all this place is pretty darn good.

data.title: We liked this place
data.text: Having picked up carryout Peruvian chicken several times previously, we decided to visit for a sit down dinner. The Pisco sour was well made. Our order of chicken with sides and the Seco de Carne Norte (sp?) came out promptly and was delicious. The service was excellent and cheerful. The place was clean and provided both cloth and paper napkins which I appreciate. We will be back.

data.title: Real Peruvian food
data.text: Being Peruvian I have high expectations when it comes to Peruvian food. This restaurant was up to the challenge. While the ambiance is not the best (it's very simple), the food totally makes up for it. The ceviche, causa de cangrejo and the chicha morada made me feel at home. Will be coming back.

data.title: Good Peruvian restaurant.
data.text: We went for dinner on a slow Saturday night. The service was prompt and attentive. We had a Ceviche de Pescado, a Chaufa de Carne, and Flan for dessert. We liked the seasoning of the Ceviche a lot, and the Flan was just spectacular. We had Chicha Morada which tasted homemade. Overall we were happy with the restaurant and will visit again.

data.title: Pretty bland versions of Peruvian food
data.text: Of our five dishes, only one stood out at all, the ceviche. Given the lack of ambiance and the not very large portions, the prices are on the high side. Service was slow and distracted.

data.title: Great Introduction to Peruvian Cuisine
data.text: For many of us in this greater Washington, DC area there are many options offering Peruvian rotisserie chicken.  This chicken, however, is only a sliver of the fascinating cuisine Peru has to offer.  The location is convenient nearby Rockville Towne Center  with validated free two-hour parking.  The restaurant is not fancy, but it is inviting.  The service was very friendly and personable.  Yes the food did take a little while, but sometimes that is not a bad thing.  I feel at times some of us have forgotten to appreciate the fact that it will take some time if someone actually makes your food when you order it.  Anyway, if you do go I urge you to venture out of your familiar zone.  The ceviche was excellent with thinly sliced tilapia bursting with citrus flavor.  The onions provided a nice contrast.  I ordered the ají de gallina, a typically Peruvian dish consisting of chicken in a yellow pepper sauce.  While it did not completely wow me I am glad I tried it.  Overall Peruvian cuisine offers so much variety as the country hosts a melting pot of Andean, South American, Asian and Italian influences.  There is likely something for everyone.

data.title: Mediocre
data.text: Two of us went to dinner on a Sunday evening.  Both of us had rotisserie chicken that was mediocre.  A bit on the dry side and not really hot.  More room temperature.  Service was friendly.  Men's room floor was soaking wet and slippery - ick.  Some entrees were in the $15-$18 range.  At this price both LA Limenia and Canal offer much better food.

data.title: Great food, great value
data.text: We had 4 adults a teen ager. We shared multiple dishes all good.  We experienced great service and the bill was reasonable for as much as we ate.  The flan dessert was amongst the best I have had.
